nodes.bodyText: Here and elsewhere, can't we automatically prefix based on a browserslist at build time?
I understand this was here before, but maybe we can improve this. What's 0px 0px 0px 0px color inset? It should have no effect unless I'm misunderstanding the intent here?

I had a wtf moment by looking at what it does live in the page actually. And I just realize that rule is staling because in the login page we don't have any input[type=submit]. I will drop completely the rule now.
That was a good catch anyway, I believe there was no reason to have the second part of the box-shadow rule. Maybe historically we had to override something else, I can't remember now. 👍

This is more of a question, and I understand this is probably historically very inconsistent, is aiming for semantically correct HTML a separate goal we try to address? For example, this would seem like a good candidate to be a <section/>.

I would agree with a refactoring to improve the semantic, I believe we are at a very low level at the moment, but probably it is better to set it as a target for another PR. I would be afraid in this case of CSS rules we have around those apply on single generic <HTML> tags. I give a 👍 to the aim, but let's do it separately.
Sounds good, maybe we can create a card or a ticket to track this somewhere? This ties in tightly with accessibility as well.
Inconsistent comment style with the rest of the file. 🙂
